column4: i have installed ubuntu for the first time and using a samsung TV/Monitor .. i get 1024x786 where as the native resolution of my monitor is 1366 x 768, can someone please help me fix it?
you have to create a modeline for your television.
: how to do that?
if you still have the manual for your television, it should have the modeline in it somewhere.
yes its HDTV
OH hum lemme go thru my manuals
is it possible to get it from the net somewhere?
after i have the modeline, wat next?
thanks
I found the manual .. looking thru I see only resolution, horz (khz), vert(khz), pixel cloack freq (mhz) .. thats all
hehe sorry but there are more variables required on that page
wats Horizontal Sync Rate?
is Horz Freq = Horz Sync?
i only have one Horz ans Vert sync .. so i put them in MIN right?
ok thanks i will try it and thencome back once done ..
i did all the changes but the resolution is the same :(
you use an NVidia graphics card?
default drivers
so X runs, but with the wrong resolution?
yes
there's a howto here: http://www.chovy.com/linux/ati-x1650-ubuntu-1440-lcd-xorg/
does nvidia works better with ubuntu or ATI?
they both have a lot of issues.
